title: The Canberra Lake: Springtime sixty-four
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australia - Social life and customs
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australia - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Canberra (A.C.T.) - Description and travel
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Burley Griffin, Lake (A.C.T.)
abstract: Lake Burley Griffin is integral to the lifestyle of Canberrans and to the design of the Capital. This charming film shows the modelling and construction of the lake, and its lively inauguration overseen by Prime Minister Robert Menzies in the springtime of 1964.
description: Canberra, the national capital of Australia, has a man-made lake in the centre of the city. We see a working model of the lake, dam, flood-gates, various transport routes and bridges. The lake, designed by Walter Burley Griffin, was opened at the end of 1964. Shows the official opening and the use of the lake for water sports.
part_of_compliation_title_or_vod_package: VoD Program; B2002695; Canberra Centenary Collection; Active; 2013
